title: Hurricane - Livestock Preparation Before the Storm

tasks.task: Reviewing herd health program for hurricane season
subtasks: Check animal vaccinations
Consider potential animal mingling and infectious diseases
Ensure unique animal identification
Obtain necessary equipment for disaster response
Store feed and water for one to two weeks
Secure feed and water storage in a dry, safe place
Ensure backup power sources (e.g., hand pumps, generators) for water access
Identify animals with high priority (e.g., expecting mothers)
Plan evacuation routes and timing based on potential complications
Move animals to higher ground if area prone to flooding
Keep animals away from barns if possible
Consider confinement of horses in secure buildings if necessary
Protect livestock from potential injuries during storms
Address horses' familiarity with pastures during storms

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Managing animal health during and after storms
subtasks: Check on animals with high priority needs
Monitor for storm-related complications (e.g., calving issues)

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Preparing horses for storm conditions
subtasks: Contain horses in stalls if out in pastures
Secure barns to prevent structural damage

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Ensuring feed safety during disasters
subtasks: Store feed in a dry, protected location
Verify feed accessibility during power outages
Schedule necessary vaccinations in advance
Develop a plan for animal evacuation and care
Train farm staff on disaster response procedures
Install unique identification methods (hot brands, electronic tags)
Maintain accurate animal records for identification purposes
